handiness_lq.Description: Laterality quotient as originally described, only using responses from Q1-10, negative is left (-100 = complete sinistrals) and positive is right (100 = complete dextrality). This is calculated by assigning exclusive laterality (-`ve for left) 2, if uses other side 1, no preference 0, and then: LQ = (sum(R) + sum(L))/(sum(R) + sum(L)) * 100

handiness_lqmod.Description: Modified laterality quotient using responses from Q1-15, negative is left (-100 = complete sinistrals) and positive is right (100 = complete dextrality): This is calculated by assigning exclusive laterality (-`ve for left) 2, if uses other side 1, no preference 0, and then: LQ = (sum(R) + sum(L))/(sum(R) + sum(L)) * 100

handiness_lq_decile.Description: Decile of normal laterality quotient, using the sign to indicate side (negative left), taken from: http://www.brainmapping.org/shared/Edinburgh.php#

handiness_lqmod_decile.Description: Decile of modified laterality quotient, using the sign to indicate side (negative left), taken from: http://www.brainmapping.org/shared/Edinburgh.php#
